text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Gunmen kill a shopkeeper at a fake roadblock in Ain el Hammam area, east of Algiers. "Terrorists" sabotage water supply network in Djelfa, south of the capital.
- The cabinet adopts a government programme and a budget.

- President Liamine Zeroual dismisses comments on the release on parole of the outlawed Islamic Salvation Front leader Abassi Madani, saying the move was undertaken within the strict framework of state law.
- The government aims to launch an ambitious programme of investment to implement Zeroual's programme on easing unemployement, mainly among the young.
- Zeroual breaks silence over latest events, renewing the state commitment to wipe out "terrorism". But ordinary citizens want to know about the government's assessment of the security situation.
